summary:
You
know, I’m 1,500 years old. I’ve killed twice as many enemies as that.
And every one of them would’ve rather killed me, but...
caption: You know, I’m 1,500 years old. I’ve killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would’ve rather killed me, but none succeeded. I’m only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest in a long line of bastards and he’ll be the latest to feel my vengeance. Fate wills it so. And if I’m wrong, then… What more could I lose?

reblog.comment: You know, I’m 1,500 years old. I’ve killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would’ve rather killed me, but none succeeded. I’m only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest in a long line of bastards and he’ll be the latest to feel my vengeance. Fate wills it so. And if I’m wrong, then… What more could I lose?

trail.content_raw: You know, I’m 1,500 years old. I’ve killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would’ve rather killed me, but none succeeded. I’m only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest in a long line of bastards and he’ll be the latest to feel my vengeance. Fate wills it so. And if I’m wrong, then… What more could I lose?
trail.content: You know, I’m 1,500 years old. I’ve killed twice as many enemies as that. And every one of them would’ve rather killed me, but none succeeded. I’m only alive because fate wants me alive. Thanos is just the latest in a long line of bastards and he’ll be the latest to feel my vengeance. Fate wills it so. And if I’m wrong, then… What more could I lose?

summary: Alright if the soul world really exists and Peter Parker’s birthday was on 10th August, DONT imagine everyone trying to figure...
body: Alright if the soul world really exists and Peter Parker’s birthday was on 10th August, DONT imagine everyone trying to figure out ways to get out of soul world and Peter tries to offer some help but everyone is tired and frustrated, so somebody snaps at Peter, saying they don’t need help from some 16 year old kid. And Peter just bows his head and whispers, “actually, I’m 17. It’s my birthday today” and everyone’s hearts just break at the look on his face

tags: the civil war will probably be instagrammed
summary:
Fics I’ll Never Write#2867:
The Civil War Will Probably Be Instagrammed
title:
Fics I’ll Never Write#2867:
The Civil War Will Probably Be Instagrammed
body:
Who loves food fics? Because I love food fics. I saw the trailer for “Little Italy” a few weeks back and now a Civil War kinda crossover idea popped into my head.

Two restaurants, both alike in dignity, in Brooklyn where we set out scene…

The Star & Shield was one of the oldest Irish pubs in Brooklyn until Sarah Rogers expanded the menu to include to include Jewish and Eastern European dishes to appeal to more of the local community. After her passing her son Steve took over the restaurant and with the help of his best friend Bucky, and all but adopted little sister Wanda, keeps her dream alive. With the addition of Sam Wilson and several soul food dishes the Star & Shield has a reputation for hearty home cooked meals, just like your grandmother used to make.

Everything is going great for them until gentrification rears its ugly head in their little corner of Brooklyn when some rich asshole takes over Carbonell’s Italian place across the street…

The Carbonell family ran the best Italian restaurant in Brooklyn and it was there that Howard Stark met Maria Carbonell. And though she married up and moved upstate, she and her son Tony were frequent visitors in Nonna Carbonell’s kitchen. Tony’s daughter was too, until sometime after her eighth birthday when Maria and Howard died in a car accident. Nonna Carbonell passed away soon after and the restaurant was willed to Tony. Wanting to distance himself from the pain he kept it in name only, leaving it to be run by a string of competent managers and chefs, until a heart attack twenty years later changes his priorities.

Following his heart attack Tony handed over the reins to his Fortune 500 company to Pepper, his long suffering assistant, and takes over running his Nonna’s restaurant. The idea is ludicrous – he hasn’t worked in a commercial kitchen since he was a teenager, and most of his meals in the last ten years were prepared by someone else – but when has that stopped him? He keeps current head chef Maria Hill on (probably because she refused to leave), brought on his personal chef/oldest friend James Rhodes, and poached a molecular gastronomy genius, Victor “Vision” Jarvis, from one of his business rivals favourite restaurants. He renovates the place as much as he dares (Nonna’s ghost glaring over his shoulder the whole time) and aims to take the little family place and make it worthy of a Michelin Star or two. And if that wasn’t enough stress on his plate, he has to fight the assholes from the dingy pub across the street for customers.

Darcy Lewis is living on the west coast, gathering a small following on Instagram for her innovative cakes and pastries, when she gets a call from Pepper who says that her dad is not relaxing like he should after his recent heart attack. She packs her things, heads back east, and walks right into WWIII. Her somewhat absent/long distance father is suddenly all about family and keeping his grandmother’s legacy alive, and asks her to at least work her magic on his dessert menu if she won’t stay on and work alongside him. And to make matter’s even more confusing she’s pretty sure one of her father’s newest enemies is the same guy she stole her first kiss from.

[Would also feature Peter and Pietro as waiters for Tony and Steve respectively, a meddling/matching food critic (Natasha), possibly a meddling/matchmaking local institution who’s seen most of the main players grow up (Peggy), and a poor supplier that just wants to finish his coffee in peace and not be drawn into all this bullshit (Clint).]

Food pics used: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8

summary: Hair War by rinnya - “Captain America, Iron Man, and Hawkeye are also present at the scene. Earlier this month, close up footage...
caption:
Hair War by rinnya - “Captain America, Iron Man, and Hawkeye are also present at the scene. Earlier this month, close up footage of Captain America braiding Black Widow’s hair was-”“Would you stop reading that?” Steve calls out, irritated. This whole thing was blown out of proportion.

“They didn’t even get my good side,” Clint complains. He throws the magazine at Tony, who startles but continues gesturing to Bruce, on the couch. “There are like, 10 pictures of Wanda’s hair, and like 2 pictures of me, and I’m not even in focus in one of them.”

——————☆彡———————–☆彡———————☆彡——————

Steve braids hair on national television, the media react like just how the public does (read: blown completely out of proportion), Tony thinks he has better hair, (and Bucky finds his way home.)

title: Monster
body:
“Have you ever asked yourself, do monsters make war, or does war make monsters?”

Two

Whatever was left of the triskelion was in shambles. I managed to make it through the interrogation process for the simple fact that I was a level one agent, openly fought against Hydra with a sparkly…

tags: marvel characters as things my friends and I have said and done
things my friends and I have said and done
summary: Marvel Characters as things my friends and I have said and done:
title: Marvel Characters as things my friends and I have said and done:
body:
Tony: *finger guns* I haveth been plagueth with the anxiety, motherf*ckers
Steve: *making a map of the 1967 Middle East war using plastic toy soldiers and flags* If any of those grade 8 twats touch this, I'm dropping my nice face.
Bruce: Supercalifragilistic existential crisis
Natasha: *starts randomly giggling in the middle of a speech about murder*
Clint: You can't stop me blasting Led Zep at my wedding
Thor: *protectively hugging friend and glaring at classmate* I will throw a f**king chair at you if you touch my cinnamon roll
Rhodey: Yeah, I'm supposed to be on two crutches, but f**k my surgeon
Sam: I've got a pineapple in my shoe
Bucky: I have to be cool around my friends *accidentally walks face-first into a wall*
Peter P: *doo-doo-doo-ing to the Wii/Mii theme song*
Wanda: Whom the f**k dares to encroach upon mine kingdom?
Vision: *learning a different language with a straight face while the class is screaming and being batsh*t crazy around them*
Loki: Jokes on you, I'm actually drawing gay fanart
T'Challa: I woke up with a cat's paw up my nose
Shuri: I'M GONNA BE MS FRIZZLE AND YOU CAN'T STOP ME

body:
Apparently,

Alexa has an Avengers trivia now…. you just need to say “Alexa open Avengers trivia”

(According to Marvel)

Can someone check and tell me if it works and if it’s good?
